page.title: 14A Queensbury Police Officer.
page.content: A Police constable may work in the police station,on a foot beat or in a car. He (works one eight-hour shift a(day.)He may need to work on every day of the week; he has to arrange his rest day but may be called to work then as well.He does not have a partner. His (duties)are the (maintenance of law (and order) and the (protection of life(and property.)While he is at work he has to help people in different ways:people who are locked out of their houses, or who are ill and may have died in their houses. He also has to go to road accidents and help people who collapse in the street, and find lost children. One Queensbury police constable (teaches swimming)to children from Fox Hill First School.
